CatDescriptText: Mr. Neil Spears, 214 Dinwiddle Street, and Mr. Tommy Echols, 614 Perry Street was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 9, 1958, pg. 3 "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?" Mr. Neil Spears' answer reads: "The Hill area is being built by Dick Construction Co., and in my opinion, the hiring policy is unfair when less than a dozen Negroes are working on that job. To whom must we look forward to in correcting this condition?"  Mr. Tommy Echols' answer reads: "No.  I think Negroes living in this area should be doing all the work on the Lower Hill- both laborers and skilled men."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Neil Spears wearing hat with striped band, and Tommy Echols wearing dark cap, standing against wall of building, street nos. 2153 and 2155
